page.title: 11A childs home life in Rawdon
page.content: School ends at 3.30 p.m. and most children are home by 4.00 p.m.Playing outside with friends or watching television are favourite pastimes along with a host of organised activities.Over half the children belong to the scouting movement.Drama and dancing lessons are popular with the girls and sports coaching with the boys.Swimming is also very popular.Two thirds of the children regularly have friends to tea.Bedtime is age related, but most read to themselves before going to sleep. At the weekend playing out and watching T.V.are equally popular.Few children shop with their parents or go to church,but many visit relations or places of interest,with walking in the Dales another favourite pursuit.
